"; $c = true; echo "c is " . is_bool($c) . "
"; $d = false; echo "d is " . is_bool($d) . "
"; ?> Definition and Usage The is_bool() function checks whether a variable is a boolean or not. This function returns true (1) if the variable is a boolean, otherwise it returns false/nothing. Syntax is_bool( variable ); Parameter Values Parameter Description variable Required. Specifies the variable to check Technical Details Return Value: TRUE if variable is a boolean, FALSE otherwise Return Type: Boolean PHP Version: 4.0+ ★ +1
